qas.question: What sort of identity was promoted by the RCC?
What identities did the RCC try to dissuade?
What were tribal leaders accused of in 1971?
Where was the military court located that tried the tribal leaders in 1971?
Of what party did Gaddafi become president in this period?

context: The RCC attempted to suppress <a1_0>regional and tribal<a1_0/> affiliation, replacing it with a unified <a0_0>pan-Libyan<a0_0/> identity. In doing so, they tried discrediting tribal leaders as agents of the old regime, and in August 1971 a <a3_0>Sabha<a3_0/> military court tried many of them for <a2_0>counter-revolutionary activity<a2_0/>. Long-standing administrative boundaries were re-drawn, crossing tribal boundaries, while pro-revolutionary modernizers replaced traditional leaders, but the communities they served often rejected them. Realizing the failures of the modernizers, Gaddafi created the <a4_0>Arab Socialist Union<a4_0/> (ASU), a mass mobilization vanguard party of which he was president. The ASU recognized the RCC as its "Supreme Leading Authority", and was designed to further revolutionary enthusiasm throughout the country.
